title: The heart of New-England hardned through wickednes in answer to a book, entituled the Heart of New-England rent, published by John Norton appointed thereunto by the General Court. The doctrine of the Quakers uindicated [sic], his ignorance manifested, and his lying doctrines brought to light and judged with the word of truth, and truth cleared from his aspersions and slanders. By him that waits to see the throne of righteousness exalted above all deceit. Francis Howgill.
author: Howgill, Francis, 1618-1669.
publisher: printed for Thomas Simmons at the Bull and Mouth near Aldersgate,
notes: A reply to: Norton, John.  The heart of New-England rent at the blasphemies of the present generation.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
